verses.kjv: Paul and Timotheus, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:
verses.ct: From Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus, to all of God's people in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, along with the overseers and deacons:

verses.kjv: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: May grace and peace come to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,
verses.ct: Every time I think of you, I thank my God.

verses.kjv: Always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy,
verses.ct: Whenever I pray for all of you, I always pray with joy,

verses.kjv: For your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now;
verses.ct: because of your partnership in the gospel from the very first day up to now.

verses.kjv: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:
verses.ct: I am completely sure of this: the one who started a good work in you will carry it through to completion on the day of Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are partakers of my grace.
verses.ct: It's only right for me to feel this way about all of you, since you hold a place in my heart. Whether I am in chains or defending and confirming the gospel, you all share in this grace with me.

verses.kjv: For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: God can testify how deeply I long for all of you with the affection of Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;
verses.ct: What I pray for is this: that your love would grow more and more, along with knowledge and complete discernment,

verses.kjv: That ye may approve things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ;
verses.ct: so that you can recognize what truly matters, and so that you will be pure and blameless until the day of Christ,

verses.kjv: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.
verses.ct: overflowing with the fruit of righteousness that comes through Jesus Christ, bringing glory and praise to God.

verses.kjv: But I would ye should understand, brethren, that the things which happened unto me have fallen out rather unto the furtherance of the gospel;
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, I want you to know that what has happened to me has actually helped spread the gospel further.

verses.kjv: So that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all other places;
verses.ct: As a result, it has become clear throughout the entire imperial guard and to everyone else that I am in chains because of Christ.

verses.kjv: And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.
verses.ct: And most of the brothers and sisters in the Lord have gained confidence because of my imprisonment, becoming far more courageous in speaking God's message without hesitation.

verses.kjv: Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:
verses.ct: It's true that some proclaim Christ out of jealousy and rivalry, but others do it with genuine goodwill.

verses.kjv: The one preach Christ of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds:
verses.ct: Those motivated by selfish ambition preach Christ insincerely, thinking they can add to my suffering while I'm in chains.

verses.kjv: But the other of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel.
verses.ct: But the others do it out of love, because they understand that I've been placed here to defend the gospel.

verses.kjv: What then? notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretence, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.
verses.ct: So what does it matter? Either way — whether from false motives or sincere ones — Christ is being proclaimed, and that makes me glad. Yes, I will continue to be glad,

verses.kjv: For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
verses.ct: because I know that through your prayers and the help given by the Spirit of Jesus Christ, this will lead to my deliverance.

verses.kjv: According to my earnest expectation and my hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life, or by death.
verses.ct: This matches my eager expectation and hope that I will never be put to shame, but that now as always, I will have complete courage so that Christ will be honored through my body, whether through living or through dying.

verses.kjv: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
verses.ct: For me, living means Christ, and dying is even better.

verses.kjv: But if I live in the flesh, this is the fruit of my labour: yet what I shall choose I wot not.
verses.ct: But if I go on living in this body, that means productive work for me. So I honestly don't know which I would choose.

verses.kjv: For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better:
verses.ct: I'm torn between the two options. I have a desire to leave this life and be with Christ, which would be far better.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.
verses.ct: But staying alive in this body is more necessary for your sake.

verses.kjv: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;
verses.ct: Since I'm convinced of this, I know that I will remain and stay with all of you to help you grow and experience joy in your faith,

verses.kjv: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.
verses.ct: so that when I come to you again, you will have even more reason to take pride in Christ Jesus because of me.

verses.kjv: Only let your conversation be as it becometh the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;
verses.ct: Just make sure you live in a way that is worthy of the gospel of Christ. Then, whether I come to visit you or only hear about you from a distance, I'll know that you are standing firm with one spirit, united in striving together for the faith of the gospel.

verses.kjv: And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.
verses.ct: Don't be frightened in any way by those who oppose you. Your courage is a sign to them of their destruction, but for you it is a sign of salvation — and this comes from God.

verses.kjv: For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;
verses.ct: For you have been given the privilege, on behalf of Christ, not only to believe in him but also to suffer for him.

verses.kjv: Having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear to be in me.
verses.ct: You are going through the same struggle that you once saw me face, and that you hear I am still facing now.
